intro: Kibatalia arborea, commonly known as the African olive, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and compound leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, oval fruits containing a single seed. It is often found in dry woodlands and thornscrubs, adapting well to poor soil conditions. The plant has historical uses in traditional medicine and as a source of timber.
